story.title: The Swap - Part 10
story.storyDescription: Jeremy was on his way to the cafe. Emma got there a bit early to think things through.

messages.text: Jeremy was on his way to the cafe. Emma got there a bit early to think things through.
She  decided that all she wanted to do was swap phones and leave.
She didn't want to give into her real feelings.
The last time she followed her heart, Jeremy tried to take advantage of her. And she got hurt.
This time, she'd be smarter about it all.
I'm almost there.
I've told you everything, Emma...
My true feelings for you...how I want things to be for us.
And now, it's your turn.
You have to decide what's right for you.
No matter how hard I try to make you stay...
Please know that I will respect your final decision.
If you choose to leave us like this...then I'll accept that.
All I'm asking is for you to be honest with yourself.
I'm scared, Jeremy.
Scared of what?
Scared of what might happen between us if I stay.
I'm just scared that if I let you in...and if I get hurt again...
...this time, I might not be able to heal.
I can't promise for things to be perfect between us, Em.
But I can promise that I'll try.
How hard are you willing to try?
As hard as you want me to.
Like that makes me feel any better...
Trust me, Emma.
Tell me the truth. Tell me everything.
Did you really mean what you said last night?
Every single word of it.
And I'm willing to say it all again. Completely sober. :)
I like you, Emma. A lot.
I want to push you away but at the same time...I want you in my arms.
It's so confusing.
That night at the party does keep haunting me...
That night at the party was horrible, Emma. And I understand how painful it must be for you.
The guy that once tried to take advantage of you is now begging you to be with him.
But your fear will eat you alive. You have to move past it.
We will never know unless we try, right?
Even if I try to give us a chance...
School is almost over...who knows where either of us will be this summer?
And then college?
Long distance never works. It's just a big waste of our time.
In case you forgot...I'm going to the same college as you.
Wait, what?
Ah, so you've dropped the ball on at least one detail, then? ;)
I don't understand.
We got into the same school, Em.
So, you've got it all planned out then?
Actually, no...
I didn't know that you were applying to same school – not until last week.
But now I see it as an opportunity for us to get to know each other better.
And for us to actually see our true selves with one another. :)
Emma was thinking about how to respond to Jeremy's last text, when a stranger approached her with a bouquet of pink tulips.
Emma's favorite flowers. She smiled ear-to-ear.
You're right. You deserve the truth, Jeremy.
If you're willing to try...I'm willing to try.
I want things to be different between us, Jeremy.
I want to be able to know you better, too.
If we both end up having real feelings for each other...that'd make me happy, too.
I like you, Jeremy. A lot.
I'm glad you like the pink tulips.
Emma jerked her head up from the phone and there he was, standing in front of her.
Emma felt like she was truly seeing Jeremy for the first time.
Jeremy couldn't take his eyes off of Emma. She was breathtaking.
They both held each other's gaze as Jeremy moved closer and closer toward Emma.
Their hearts were both racing.
Jeremy handed Emma her phone, and she handed him his, and she said:
You're blushing. Just like the tulips.
You are beautiful, Emma. Gorgeous.
Omg, stop. You're making it worse!
Haha. I'm just being honest.
No one has ever taken my breath away quite like you do.
And you're just sitting there, holding a bouquet of pink tulips.
Emma put the tulips down and stood up.
Before she knew exactly what was happening, Jeremy grabbed her by the waist and pulled her in close.
And then, he kissed her.
